column3: Took a job as a home health aide with the Visiting Nurses Association of Franklin County.  Used bathwater to scold a retarded child over 60% of his body.  Was not prosecuted

column4: Graduated from Greenfield Community College with a diploma in nursing

column3: A pattern began to emerge of an unusually large number of deaths in Ward C, during Gilbert’s work shift there.  One doctor refused to let her treat anymore of his patients.

column3: Kristen Gilbert was jokingly given the name “Angel of Death” by her co-workers, because so many people dropped dead while in her care

column3: Kills patient, Stanley Jagodowski (WM, 66)
Perrault rented an apartment in Easthampton, to be closer to Gilbert
Gilbert moved out of her house to an apartment complex on Northampton Street
Kills patient, Henry Hudon (WM, 35)
Kristen Gilbert filed for divorce from Glenn Gilbert
Kills patient, Kenny Cutting (WM, 41)
Three nurses, John Wall, Kathy Rix, and Renee Walsh, came forward about concerns and accusations against Gilbert.  Police investigation began on Gilbert
Kills patient, Edward Skwira (WM, 68)
Gilbert confessed to killing patients during a phone call she made to Perrault
Perrault acquired a restraining order against Gilbert
Perrault, summoned to a Grand Jury, testified against Gilbert
Glenn Gilbert asked investigators to come to his house and search a pantry which had belonged to Kristen.  Inside, investigators found  “The Handbook of Poisoning”
Gilbert was temporarily placed in a psychiatric ward in Arbour Hospital for the third time that month.
Kristen appeared at Glenn Gilbert's house and attempted to attack him with car keys
Gilbert called the Leeds VAMC hospital with a false bomb threat
Court ordered Gilbert to be placed in Baystate Medical Center
Gilbert was released from Baystate Medical Center and arrested
Released from prison and ordered by court to live in Seataucket, Long Island, New York with her parents
Indicted on felony charges for falsely phoning a bomb threat to a federal institution
Last known victim Edward Skwira's body was exhumed to test for epinephrine
Trial began for Gilbert’s false bomb threat

Gilbert was found guilty of falsely phoning a bomb threat to a federal institution. She was thought to have phoned this threat to divert attention away from the murder investigation against her.  She was sentenced to fifteen months at Danbury Federal Prison and treated for psychiatric problems.  There she served her sentence while awaiting the start of her murder trial
Kristen Gilbert was officially indicted for murder
Victim Stanley Jagodowski's remains were exhumed to test for epinephrine

Gilbert was moved from her cell in Danbury to Hamden County House of 
Correction in Ludlow, MA.  Gilbert remained there till the murder trial was finished
Jury was chosen, consisting of nine women and three men to serve in Gilbert’s trial
Trial began for Kristen Gilbert’s murders
Glenn Gilbert testified against his ex-wife, and told the court that Kristen had confessed to the murders
Deliberations for Government vs. Kristen Gilbert were underway.  The case consisted of more than 70 witnesses and 200 pieces of evidence
Gilbert was found guilty of three counts of first-degree murder, one count of second-degree murder, and two counts of attempted murder
Jury sentenced Gilbert to 4 consecutive life terms without the possibility of parole, plus 20 years
Gilbert was transferred from a federal prison for women in Framingham, MA, to a federal prison in Carswell, TX, where she has remained ever since
Kristen Gilbert dropped her federal appeal for a new trial, due to a recent US Supreme Court ruling that would have allowed prosecutors to pursue the death penalty
